dt: {bc}the use of means (such as charms or spells) believed to have supernatural power over natural forces
{bc}an extraordinary power or influence seemingly from a supernatural source

dt.t: Both pitchers, although they are older, haven't lost their {wi}magic{/wi}.

dt: {bc}something that seems to cast a spell {bc}{sx|enchantment||}

dt.t: all the mystery, {wi}magic{/wi} and romance which belong to royalty alone

dt: {bc}the art of producing illusions by sleight of hand

dt.t: entertained with acts of jugglery and {wi}magic{/wi}

et: Middle English {it}magique{/it}, from Middle French, from Latin {it}magice{/it}, from Greek {it}magikē{/it}, feminine of {it}magikos{/it} Magian, magical, from {it}magos{/it} magus, sorcerer, of Iranian origin; akin to Old Persian {it}maguš{/it} sorcerer
shortdef: the use of means (such as charms or spells) believed to have supernatural power over natural forces
an extraordinary power or influence seemingly from a supernatural source
having seemingly supernatural qualities or powers

dt: {bc}to produce, remove, or influence by magic

shortdef: to produce, remove, or influence by magic

dt: {bc}a substance or therapy capable of destroying pathogens (such as bacteria or cancer cells) or providing an effective remedy for a disease or condition without deleterious side effects
{bc}something providing an effective solution to a difficult or previously unsolvable problem

dt.t: a {it}magic bullet{/it} to stem voter apathy

shortdef: a substance or therapy capable of destroying pathogens (such as bacteria or cancer cells) or providing an effective remedy for a disease or condition without deleterious side effects
something providing an effective solution to a difficult or previously unsolvable problem

dt: {bc}an early form of optical projector of still pictures using a transparent slide

shortdef: an early form of optical projector of still pictures using a transparent slide

dt: {bc}a fungus (such as genus {it}Psilocybe{/it}) containing hallucinogenic alkaloids (such as psilocybin)

shortdef: a fungus (such as genus Psilocybe) containing hallucinogenic alkaloids (such as psilocybin)

dt: {bc}painting in a meticulously realistic style of imaginary or fantastic scenes or images
{bc}a literary genre or style associated especially with Latin America that incorporates fantastic or mythical elements into otherwise realistic fiction

shortdef: painting in a meticulously realistic style of imaginary or fantastic scenes or images
a literary genre or style associated especially with Latin America that incorporates fantastic or mythical elements into otherwise realistic fiction —called also magical realism

dt: {bc}a square containing a number of integers arranged so that the sum of the numbers is the same in each row, column, and main diagonal and often in some or all of the other diagonals

shortdef: a square containing a number of integers arranged so that the sum of the numbers is the same in each row, column, and main diagonal and often in some or all of the other diagonals

dt: {bc}a carpet that can carry a person through the air

shortdef: a carpet that can carry a person through the air
